title: Explore SQL Expressions with The Traitors UK Dashboard

blocks.content:
## Introduction

This dashboard provides an overview of the state of play in series 4 of the UK TV show "The Traitors" originally aired in January 2026.

It is a demonstration of how powerful Grafana's SQL expressions transform can be.  The data source used is a simple Google Sheet, with all data formatting and aggregation performed using SQL expressions inside Grafana.

## The Main Game

The main part of the game plays out over the first 11 episodes.  Each episode, the players tackle a physical challenge that may also involve solving puzzles.  Success in these challenges earns money towards the overall prize pot.

At the round table, players discuss theories about who the traitors might be and then vote for the person they think is most likely a traitor.  That person is then banished from the game immediately, revealing their status on the way out.

Overnight, the traitors meet to determine which of the faithful they will murder.  That person leaves the game overnight and the remaining contestants find out who they are when they fail to show up for breakfast in the morning.

Contestants may earn a shield during the day's challenge.  This protects them from murder by the traitors.  Sometimes the traitors know who, if anyone, has a shield.  Other times they don't.  Traitors also have the option to recruit a new traitor from the faithful players as an alternative to murdering.



Each panel in this section uses data contained in a Google Sheet, transformed using only Grafana SQL expressions.
We'll begin our tour with the Main Game section of the dashboard.
We've used high visibility glanceable stat panels in this section to summarize the state of the game.  This panel shows us how many traitors are active at the current time.

blocks.reftarget: section[data-testid='data-testid Panel header Most Votes Received (Grey = inactive player)']
blocks.content: A bar chart shows how many votes each player has received across all of the round tables.  We use grey bars to indicate that the player is no longer in the game due to banishment or murder.

blocks.reftarget: section[data-testid='data-testid Panel header Player Status by Episode (Fiona was hidden Traitor eps 1-3)']
blocks.content: The status history panel provides a great way to track each player's status over time.  For the first three episodes there was a hidden traitor whose status wasn't revealed to anyone, so we had to assume some players were faithful until the hidden traitor's identity was revealed.

Finally, there's a repeating section that show's status and voting history for each player along with their picture.  This section is repeated for each player using a dashboard variable.  Take a moment to look at Adam's status.

## The End Game

The end game takes place in episode 12, after a final round table.  The remaining contestants take part in a series of votes.  Each contestant can choose to end the game, or banish someone else because they think one or more traitors remain.

If one or more contestant votes to banish, each contestant names the person they want to banish and the one with the most votes leaves immediately without declaring whether they were a faithful or a traitor.  If everyone agrees to end the game, it ends immediately with the prize going to the faithfuls if no traitors remain or the traitors if one or more of them remain. The game also ends should only two players remain.

The end game was modeled using SQL expressions and a different Google Sheet.
Let's take a look at the End Game section of the dashboard.

blocks.reftarget: section[data-testid='data-testid Panel header End Game Round 2']
blocks.content: Here we see the ultimate outcome of the game, with Jack banished in the final vote.  Rachel and Stephen won, having played as traitors since the beginning.
We used a dynamic image panel to show the winners images as a carousel.
This gauge shows how much of the overall £120,000 prize fund the winners took home between them.  We didn't model the prize fund in the Google Sheet, it's static data in the panel here.

## SQL Expressions in Grafana

How did we build this dashboard?  Every panel uses the same combination of data source and transform.  The data always comes from a Google Sheet.  As you'll see in this guide, the data itself is very simple - for each episode we added a row to the spreadsheet for each active player containing just:

- The episode number.
- The player's name.
- Which team the player was on in that episode.
- Who the player voted for in that episode.
- Whether the player was murdered or banished in that episoide.
- The date that the episode aired.

All of the aggregations that you see displayed in the dashboard were created in Grafana using the SQL expressions transformation.  The only data source queries to the Google Sheet simply fetch all the data in the format that it was recorded in.

In the following sections of this guide, you'll discover how this works...
First, open the Latest Episode panel for editing.

steps.reftarget: section[data-testid='data-testid Panel header Latest Episode'] svg[data-testid='icon-ellipsis-v']

blocks.content: Now, take a look at the Google Sheets query configuration.  There's no range of cells specified here, so the query will read every cell in the spreadsheet.
Toggle table view, then unhide the results from the Google Sheets query.
Now you can see the raw data from the spreadsheet.
Study the SQL expression that we're using here to summarize the data.
Hide the results of the original Google Sheets query.
Here you see the result of the SQL expression, which becomes the value used in the stat panel.
To continue our tour, click the "Back to dashboard" button to exit the panel editor.

blocks.title: Discover a More Complex SQL Expression

blocks.content: intro text
open the most votes received panel and view the data returned by the sql expression

steps.reftarget: section[data-testid='data-testid Panel header Most Votes Received (Grey = inactive player)'] svg[data-testid='icon-ellipsis-v']

blocks.content: take a look at the sql expression
return to the dashboard view
intro text and links to what variables are etc

study the sql expression

## Next Steps and Additional Resources

Check  out these additional resources to learn more about the topics covered in this guide:

- [The Google Sheet used for the Main Game](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1VcaZ4q8ZM2k6O9f6BGMRiWbXYbPQ3gbjLlFuAM4BcJU/view).
- [The Google Sheet used for the End Game](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/11FVTJmhYQAWG9BUddAcr2gNsjZVvcFaKN3V2DdK9Cnc/view).
- [SQL expressions documentation](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/latest/visualizations/panels-visualizations/query-transform-data/sql-expressions/).
- [Google Sheets data source documentation](https://grafana.com/grafana/plugins/grafana-googlesheets-datasource/).
- [Dynamic image panel](https://grafana.com/grafana/plugins/dalvany-image-panel/).
- [The Traitors USA dashboard](https://play.grafana.org/d/adfhkge/usa-traitors-season-4) (a similar dashboard for the US version of the show).
